Mike Kelly wrote:

> The human web (of documents?) had the luxury of being able to put 
> resource relationships/hyperlinks in context via natural language and 
> symbolism; this is something that is not afforded by the machine web
Not at the current stage of development, but with so much work being 
done in Semantic Web and even in AI, that gap will undoubtedly narrow, 
so designing for a "machine web" should aim in that direction also.
